intro: Neolloydia intertexta var. dasyacantha, commonly known as the stiff-spined kalahari thornveld plant, is a succulent shrub native to southern Africa. It features dense, spiny stems that are often covered in a whitish, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers during the rainy season, typically in spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
